title: Workshop on Integrating Computational Thinking Pedagogy for Elementary Science Classes

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic programming concepts and familiarity with elementary science curriculum content
context.additional_context: Practice-centered workshops for current and pre-service elementary teachers, applying Design-Based Implementation Research (DBIR) with activity-centered designs using digital devices (tablets/laptops)

learning_goals: Design instructional modules integrating computational thinking (problem decomposition, pattern recognition, algorithm design) into science curricula (probability/statistics)
Develop at least three science concept visualization activities using Scratch programming
Conduct a collaborative lesson design process with peer teachers by applying the DBIR (Data-Based Instructional Redesign) framework
Develop assessment tools to analyze improvements in learners' computational thinking through project-based evaluation
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
